title: Ayda Field looks sensational in a 70s inspired green velvet suit as she returns to Loose Women
text:
She's a proud mother-of-three who has just returned to the Loose Women panel.

And Ayda Field made sure to make a fashion statement in a 70s inspired green velvet suit for her first time back on the popular daytime TV show on Wednesday.

The actress, 40, looked sensational in the flared bottoms which showed off her toned figure and the fitted jacket which boasted shoulder pads.

Groovy: Ayda Field, 40, looked sensational a green velvet suit with flared bottoms as she made her return to the Loose Women panel in London on Wednesday

Ayda paired her suit with a patterned shirt, which appeared to have cheetahs on and included a velvet bow tie on the neck.

She added height to her frame in black peep-toe platform heels and accessorised with a stylish square shaped handbag with brown leather corners.

The beauty wore her caramel tresses down for the appearance and added some bouncy curls to give her sleek locks volume.

Chic: The actress showed off her toned physique in the suit which she paired with a patterned shirt and platform peep-toe heels

Style: Ayda wore her tresses down and curled for her TV return and added some bouncy curls to give her sleek locks volume

On Wednesday morning Ayda appeared on Loose Women where she revealed she would like 'one more' baby as a 'teammate' for her youngest child.

Ayda already has daughter Teddy, seven, son Charlie, five, and baby girl Coco, 14 months, with husband Robbie Williams, 45, and said motherhood is by far her 'greatest pleasure' in life.

Speaking during her return to the panel, Ayda joked that while she would like to expand her family further, Robbie would 'commit her and run away with Gary Barlow into the sunset' if they have more than four children.

Stunning: The American-born actress, who has been married to singer Robbie Williams since 2010, kept her makeup simple with a nude lipstick on Wednesday

Flaunt it: Ayda carried a stylish square shaped bag with leather corners as she left the studio

Ayda said it would be good for Coco - who was born via a surrogate - to have a 'teammate' close in age because her siblings are so much older.

She explained: 'The difference is because Teddy and Charlie were so close in age, they didn't dote on each other, they were more jealous.

'Whereas with Coco they want to feed her and play with her and show her things, she’s a living doll for them.

'Sometimes I have to remind them she's my child and I'm in charge, but they're the best siblings. I think Coco will want a teammate to rally against her brother and sister, but they're such an amazing unit.

Family: Ayda appeared on Loose Women where she revealed she would like 'one more' baby as a 'teammate' for her youngest child

Baby of the bunch: The former X Factor judge said it would be good for Coco - who was born via a surrogate - to have a 'teammate' close in age because her siblings are so much older

The TV personality also discussed her ongoing battle with guilt as a working mother, admitting Teddy wasn't happy to see her return to the ITV1 daytime show.

She said: '[Teddy said] "Mommy, I'm so used to you being here that when you go I'm like a flower and half my petals are gone". I mean, owwwww. I almost broke down in tears when Teddy said that to me.'

The American-born star added that she doesn't think her husband feels the same guilt when he's working away.

She said: 'When he's on the plane he feels a sense of duty, whereas with me I feel like, "Why am I doing this? I'm so selfish".

Doting: The mother-of-three has daughter Teddy, seven, son Charlie, five, and baby girl Coco, 14 months, with Robbie, 45, and said parenting is by far her 'greatest pleasure' in life

Happy couple: Ayda and Robbie met when he was living in Los Angeles in 2006 and married at the Angels hitmaker's home in Beverly Hills in August 2010 (pictured in October 2018)

Ayda and Robbie met when he was living in Los Angeles in the summer of 2006.

The couple got engaged over Christmas in 2009 and married at the Angels hitmaker's home in Beverly Hills in August 2010.

Theodora Rose, known as Teddy, came into the world in September 2012, followed by Charlton Valentine, aka Charlie, in October 2014.

Ayda and Robbie welcomed their third child, Colette Josephine, known as Coco, via a surrogate in September 2018.
description: Ayda Field, 40, made a bold fashion statement in flared velvet bottoms and a jacket with shoulder pads as she returned to filming Loose Women in London on Wednesday.
